Description: Rim sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl; white slip; interior: traces of black band at rim; below, black-figure decoration consisting of possible lion (open mouth remaining) to right; at right, rump with added red of lion seated to right; incised pendant and full rosettes with red in centres as filling ornament; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of frieze of possible sirens to left (from left, outspread wing with red and tail feathers of siren; head and chest of second siren); incised pendant and full rosettes with red in centres as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Lemos places this sherd in Group E of the Sphinx and Lion Style. The vases in this group are the latest in the series of the Sphinx and Lion Style and the execution of the imagery is done in a hurried manner with no attention to detail. The figures are sketchy and, in some cases, difficult to identify.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 148, p. 311, no. 1303, pl. 168)
CVA Heidelberg I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Heidelberg Universität Band I (p. 13, no. 17, pl. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2098) (phase 2)
